## About This Workshop

::: {.content-section}
Welcome to the DataSHIELD + OMOP CDM workshop, a comprehensive training program designed to empower researchers at the African Population and Health Research Center (APHRC) with cutting-edge tools for secure, collaborative health data analysis.

::: {.row .align-items-center .mt-4}
::: {.col-md-8}
This workshop combines two powerful technologies:

- **DataSHIELD**: A method that enables the analysis of sensitive research data without physically sharing the data itself
- **OMOP CDM**: A common data model that standardizes the structure and content of observational health data

Our goal is to provide APHRC researchers with the skills and knowledge to implement these technologies in their research, fostering collaboration while maintaining the highest standards of data privacy and security.
:::

## Workshop Objectives

::: {.content-section}
:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### Technical Skills
- Set up and configure DataSHIELD environments
- Transform health data to OMOP CDM format
- Perform federated analyses across multiple sites
- Implement privacy-preserving statistical methods
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### Research Applications
- Design multi-site epidemiological studies
- Analyze real-world health data
- Collaborate across institutions securely
- Generate evidence for health policy
:::

### ISGlobal - Barcelona Institute for Global Health

The **Bioinformatics Research Group in Epidemiology (BRGE)** at ISGlobal specializes in developing and applying computational methods for large-scale epidemiological studies. Our team combines expertise in bioinformatics, statistics, and public health to advance precision medicine and population health research.

### African Population and Health Research Center

APHRC is a leading Africa-based research institution that generates evidence to inform decision-making for improved health and development in Africa. The center brings together African scholars to lead the development of evidence-based policies and programs in the region.

::: {.mt-3}

## Ready to Join?

::: {.callout-important}
## Before You Start

Make sure you're prepared for the workshop! Complete the setup requirements and review the prerequisites.

**Essential steps:**
- Install R and RStudio
- Set up required packages
- Review pre-reading materials
- Test your technical setup

[**Get Started Now →**](getting-started.qmd){.btn .btn-primary .btn-lg}
:::

## Workshop Format

The workshop will be delivered through a combination of:

- **Interactive lectures** introducing key concepts
- **Hands-on practical sessions** with real-world examples
- **Group exercises** to reinforce learning
- **Q&A sessions** for addressing specific use cases
- **Networking opportunities** with peers and instructors
